Name: Bell with The Dwarf God Bes
Description: The bell is a calotte shape and is richly decorated. The handle is decorated with two representations of the dwarf god Bes, depicted back to back. The sides of the bell are decorated with four motifs: the head of a ram, the side view of a crocodile, the head of the jackal god Anubis, and a sphinx lying on the udjat eye. The bell was found without its tongue and its suspension ring.
